title: [歐霸保衛戰] AC 米蘭球迷討論區 68

replies.msg:
Forza Milan



2017/2018球季意甲賽程：

常見問題：
AC米蘭同國際米蘭又係有"米蘭"，應該點分？
ANS：AC米蘭簡稱米蘭，國際米蘭叫國米，避免稱呼做AC，因為AC係球會咁解，而milan先係名既簡稱。
AC米蘭仲係咪「老人院」？
ANS：現時全隊平均年齡為25歲。
今個轉會窗到目前為止簽咗咁多球員，遲啲仲會唔會有錢買人？
ANS：其實買球員好少會一炮過畀，多數都係分期，所以仲會有錢簽其他球員。
簽咗咁多球員會唔會過唔到FFP？
ANS：早前米蘭管理層有同UEFA探討經營計劃。
http://sempremilan.com/ts-fassone-meets-uefa-to-discuss-ac-milan-business-plan（By 二石四鳥)

本場比賽最後階段Gigio出現了失誤，導致米蘭最後時刻被追平。賽後有報道比賽結束後幾名米蘭球員走向看台，其中包括邦路斯和羅馬洛尼，他們把球衣拋給了遠道而來的米蘭球迷。

但當當拿奴馬脫下球衣走向看台時，米蘭球迷團體的領導人揮手叫他回去，球迷不想要他的球衣。當拿奴馬看起來很表情沮喪，帶著球衣走進了更衣室。

Villarreal demand Bacca discount

Carlos Bacca confirmed Villarreal are negotiating with Milan to lower the option to buy. “I hope it can be resolved quickly.”

The 31-year-old Colombia international is currently on loan with an option to buy for €15.5m, on top of the €2.5m paid last summer, but Villarreal don’t seem prepared to pay the full amount.

He has scored 18 goals with seven assists in 43 competitive games this season.

“I am calm, as I am happy here and focused only on the next game and international duty,” Bacca told AS.

“Villarreal are talking to Milan and my agent to work the issue out and I hope my future can be resolved quickly.”

Milan paid €30m to sign Bacca from Sevilla in the summer of 2015.

Mirabelli: ‘Milan will sign Reina’

Milan sporting director Massimiliano Mirabelli confirms they’ll sign Napoli's Pepe Reina on a free transfer - “we need people with experience”.

The Spaniard is out of contract on June 30, and it has been widely reported for several months that he’ll move north to join the Rossoneri.

“We had the opportunity to get him for free, and we think it was useful strategically,” Mirabelli told Tiki Taka.

“We’ll have a lot of competition, Reina can help us off the pitch, in addition to his contribution on it.

“We need people with experience and he’s one of those.”

Mirabelli was then asked if the Spaniard’s arrival means Gianluigi Donnarumma will leave.

“I already told your other colleagues that it’s not just down to Donnarumma, it involves everyone. A player has to come to us and tell us he doesn’t want to stay, and that’s not the case with Donnarumma.

“If that does happen, there would also have to be a club ready to meet Milan’s asking price. For now neither condition has been satisfied.”

‘Referees sympathise with Juventus’


Former Inter President Massimo Moratti calls Juventus “the strongest and most complete team in Italy”, but insists they get “sympathy” from referees.

The Bianconeri have won the Scudetto for the seventh season in a row, and the former patron was asked about their dominance of Italian football.

“Juventus are the strongest and most complete team in Italy,” Moratti admitted, speaking to Corriere della Sera.

“That’s also due to having the same ownership for so long. At the moment, given the situation of the national team, they represent Italian football.

“That means they have the respect and sympathy of those who work in Italian football - like the referees.”

Man Utd call in Bonucci

Jose Mourinho will try to tempt Milan captain Leonardo Bonucci to Manchester United, claims Tuttosport.

According to Wednesday’s edition of the Turin-based newspaper, Mou has his heart set on Bonucci as the ideal reinforcement for his back line.

The centre-back turned 31 this month and had a difficult first year with the Rossoneri, at times feeling excessive pressure from immediately being named captain.

If he were to move on, Milan would need to make a profit, having paid €42m to sign him from Juventus only a year ago.

At the time, it was reported Bonucci wanted to leave Juve due to a row with Max Allegri and had been heavily linked with Chelsea for Antonio Conte as well as Real Madrid.

However, he didn’t want to leave Italy because his youngest son had very serious health issues.

Fortunately, Bonucci’s son has recovered and a Premier League switch is back on the cards.

Donnarumma-Cavani exchange idea

Mediaset Premium claim Gianluigi Donnarumma could join Paris Saint-Germain in part-exchange for Edinson Cavani.

Rossoneri director of sport Massimiliano Mirabelli commented several times over the last few days that they will “see if any offers satisfy us” for the 19-year-old goalkeeper.

According to Mediaset Premium’s Milan expert and match commentator Carlo Pellegatti, Donnarumma will leave San Siro this summer.

His rapport with the fans has broken down again following errors in the Coppa Italia Final with Juventus and 1-1 draw with Atalanta, as he tried to throw his shirt to the ultras at the final whistle and they refused it.

PSG have consistently been mentioned as a top contender should Donnarumma walk away and it’s now reported Cavani could be included as part of the deal.

It would be a return to Serie A for the 31-year-old Uruguay international, who played for Palermo and Napoli until his €64.5m move to Paris in the summer of 2013.

This season, Cavani has scored 40 goals with 12 assists in 48 competitive matches, but made no secret of his frustration with teammate Neymar.

Man Utd call in Bonucci

Jose Mourinho will try to tempt Milan captain Leonardo Bonucci to Manchester United, claims Tuttosport.

According to Wednesday’s edition of the Turin-based newspaper, Mou has his heart set on Bonucci as the ideal reinforcement for his back line.

The centre-back turned 31 this month and had a difficult first year with the Rossoneri, at times feeling excessive pressure from immediately being named captain.

If he were to move on, Milan would need to make a profit, having paid €42m to sign him from Juventus only a year ago.

At the time, it was reported Bonucci wanted to leave Juve due to a row with Max Allegri and had been heavily linked with Chelsea for Antonio Conte as well as Real Madrid.

However, he didn’t want to leave Italy because his youngest son had very serious health issues.

Fortunately, Bonucci’s son has recovered and a Premier League switch is back on the cards.

Milan enter Florenzi race


Milan have reportedly joined Juventus and city rivals Inter in the chase for Roma’s Alessandro Florenzi.

The Italian international is out of contract at the end of next season, though the Giallorossi are trying to tie him down to a new deal.

Florenzi’s priority is to remain with his boyhood club, and his entourage have asked for a five-year contract with a salary rising from €4m over the course of the deal.

However, those figures are difficult for the capital club to meet, as they’re still operating with Financial Fair Play in mind.

Now Gazzetta dello Sport is reporting that Milan have joined Inter and Juventus attempting to sign the versatile 27-year-old.

The Nerazzurri are ready to push for his signature if they can’t sign Joao Cancelo outright from Valencia, and it’s thought they’d be favourites for his signature.

It was Luciano Spalletti who converted Florenzi from a midfielder to a rampaging full-back, and he may be keen to work with his former Coach once again.

Lokomotiv Moscow want Kalinic

Lokomotiv Moscow are reportedly interested in Milan striker Nikola Kalinic, but the price-tag is €25m.

The centre-forward was signed a year ago from Fiorentina for €5m with obligation to buy for another €20m.

He scored only five goals with six assists in 40 competitive appearances for the Rossoneri and is not believed to be in their plans for next term.

According to Calciomercato.com, Lokomotiv Moscow are expected to make an offer over the next 10 days.

They have been informed the price-tag is €25m, as Milan don’t want to make a loss on the 30-year-old Croatia international.

Schalke 04 are also interested and just qualified for the Champions League.

The Rossoneri are seemingly looking to sell their youngster, Gigio Donnarumma, this summer. However, it will be more complicated than expected, as the clubs interested have explored other opportunities.

After announcing he’s leaving Juventus, Buffon received a lucrative offer from PSG, which is he seriously considering. A two-year contract worth about €7m per year has been offered to the veteran. Furthermore, after an impressive season, Roma’s Alisson could leave this summer to join Real Madrid.


Fassone and Mirabelli, who have already signed Reina, are looking for a club that can buy Donnarumma and are betting their money on PSG, however, now they will have to look elsewhere. Even Real Madrid had been discussed as a possible destination for the youngster, although it seems the Bernabeu side will move for Alisson.

England and Premier League seems more likely for the Rossoneri, with Liverpool interested in their jewel. In fact, Raiola has already spoken with the Reds, who decided to postpone any meetings until after the Champions League final on May 26.

The Italian-Dutch agent wants Donnarumma to sell for €30m, while Milan want around €30m more.

Even Real Madrid had been discussed as a possible destination for the youngster, although it seems the Bernabeu side will move for Alisson.

England and Premier League seems more likely for the Rossoneri, with Liverpool interested in their jewel. In fact, Raiola has already spoken with the Reds, who decided to postpone any meetings until after the Champions League final on May 26.

The Italian-Dutch agent wants Donnarumma to sell for €30m, while Milan want around €30m more.

Dida gives Donnarumma advice

Former Milan goalkeeper Nelson Dida gave Gianluigi Donnarumma advice after he was jeered by fans. “I hope he learns from mistakes.”

The Rossoneri host Fiorentina at 17.00 UK time (16.00 GMT), click here for the line-ups and Liveblog.

“I am happy to be at San Siro, to see these fans again who were so wonderful with me,” Dida told Milan TV.

Donnarumma was jeered during the warm-up, having received a lot of criticism for recent performances against Juventus and Atalanta.

“We goalkeepers know that we experience pressure every time we step on to the field. With the errors Donnarumma made, I hope he learned something, as I know that I always did.

“He has already proved that he’s a great goalkeeper and now can become even stronger. The advice I give him is to stay calm.”

Gianluigi Buffon played his final match in a Juventus jersey on Saturday, but is considering a move abroad.

“It was emotional seeing Buffon wave goodbye to Juventus yesterday. He is a legend and has always proved it, so I hope he can continue playing.

“I remember in the Champions League Final in Manchester, we had a chat before the penalties and wished each other luck. Fortunately, we won!”
